When you purchased this mystery you received a PDF game guide. The app replaces sections of that guide:

’Introductory Materials’ (Section 1)
’Party Guide’ (Section II)
No need to print those sections! Everything you need is in the app.

However, you will still have to print certain pages from ’Printed Materials’ (Section III), such as nametages, awards, etc. The app includes print instructions.

Now let’s get started hosting!

pageList.title: Preview
pageList.HTML: You have been invited to the anniversary bash of Mr. Francis Fisk, a noted businessman. The guest list includes a number of Fisk’s high-society friends, family members, and business associates. Everyone is expecting an evening dinner, drinks, dancing and gossip—they aren’t expecting a black out and a grisly murder in the darkness.

pageList.title: Introduction
pageList.HTML:
Section I of this instruction manual contains all of the introductory materials necessary for planning and preparing your party. In this section you will find a basic overview of the plot; a description of each of the characters; tips on preparing your playing area, choosing a menu, and organizing your printouts; and detailed instructions on how to go about inviting players and assigning characters.

Please note: The majority of the contents of this book are intended for the eyes of the Host/Hostess only! The success of your party hinges on a strong element of intrigue and mystery, so be certain not to share this book with other players. The material that should be provided to your guests is clearly described in this book. Under no circumstances should you allow any of your players access to this book!

pageList.title: Welcome!
pageList.HTML:
Thank you for choosing Murder in Manhattan. This package contains everything you need to host a spectacular Murder Mystery party that your guests will remember for many years to come. Included are materials for hosting a party for anywhere from 10 to 25 participants (including yourself). Note that the game is played the same way no matter how many guests you have. This is because only the ten required characters are critical to solving the mystery; the additional guests just add more personalities to the fun!

Murder Mystery Parties are essentially a combination of improvisational acting, storytelling, and creative problem solving. Your guests will each assume the role of a particular character and will play the part of that character throughout the course of the game. Each character has personality traits, goals, secrets, and information, all of which are included in the character sheet. A big part of the entertainment value of Mystery Parties is getting into character and trying to achieve your character’s individual goals.

At some point during the party, an Event will occur that will force the players to come together in order to solve a problem or unravel a mystery. Traditionally, the Event in question will be the murder of one of the characters (as played by a guest), but the basic framework of a Mystery Party can accommodate numerous different types of Events.

The guests will need to use the information that their characters know (as well as additional clues that are provided during the game) to solve the mystery or overcome the problem posed by the Event. Typically this culminates in the guests voting on the identity of the murderer, but again, different parties will have different goals. The party may also have certain additional subgames built into the framework; for example, many Mystery Parties will have some form of scavenger hunt built into the story.

Once the mystery has been solved or the problem has been overcome, the party draws to a close. Guests are provided with an opportunity to vote on the best actor/actress, the best dressed player, and so forth and then are given certificates and awards for their participation in the game.

Throughout the course of the party, the Host/Hostess is responsible for ensuring that the event continues to run smoothly. He or she sets the scene, provides dinner and drinks, and moves the plot along at key points by reading scripted descriptions of what is happening. Frequently the Host/Hostess will also play one of the characters.

This particular Mystery Party, Murder in Manhattan, is a murder mystery wherein each party guest will be playing the role of a guest or employee of Irene den Waldern at an anniversary bash for Francis Fisk, and the Host/Hostess will be playing the part of Taylor Walker, a caterer.

The party takes place in two acts. During Act One, guests will mingle over food and drinks until Francis Fisk is shockingly murdered during a blackout that left the room pitch black and created an opening for the killer. The guests will then search for clues during Act Two and, upon reviewing the evidence, will vote for who they think committed the crime. They should discover the killer was an architect that Francis was going to expose to the police for his previous crimes.

Please be advised:

The parties developed by PWM Press are substantially more complex and detailed than other similar products. Even if you are experienced at hosting Murder-Mystery Parties, it is imperative that you read chapters one through seven carefully and completely before beginning to plan out your party!

pageList.title: What is my Role?
pageList.HTML:
As the Host or Hostess, your role in the party is that of a facilitator or a storyteller. It is your job to plan the event, prepare the playing area, and, once the game begins, move the story along and make certain that everyone is on task and enjoying themselves.

In many Mystery Parties the Host or Hostess is given the option to not learn the identity of the murderer before the end of the game, thereby allowing him or her to participate in the party the same way as the other guests. However, because Murder in Manhattan is a more complex party, it is necessary for the Host or Hostess to have a clear understanding of all key plot points in order to ensure that the game runs smoothly. This means that you will be aware of the killer and the victim’s identity in advance.

You will be playing the role of Taylor Walker, a caterer hired for the event. As a caterer you will be able to watch over your event in character to make sure everything runs smoothly while still enjoying the opportunity to play someone with their own secrets, motivations, and goals.

pageList.title: How do I get Started?
pageList.HTML: Start by reading this book thoroughly. The importance of this cannot be overemphasized! This book contains detailed information on every aspect of planning and executing your party, and you will find that a comprehensive understanding of the source material will make your responsibilities as Host or Hostess much simpler and more enjoyable.

taskList.title: Read the entire guide

pageList.title: Several Weeks Before Party
pageList.HTML:
Once you have read the entire guide, you can start planning. The first steps should be taken at least a week before the party or as soon as possible if the party is less than a week away.

Decide on the date of your event. The more time you give yourself to prepare, the more successful your event will be. It is recommended that you give yourself a minimum of two weeks to prepare for your party.
Decide on your location, menu, and decorations. You have numerous options for determining how to decorate your venue and what food to serve. You should decide on these options well in advance of the actual party and create a list of supplies that you will need. Refer to Chapter Three (under Props, Menu, and Setting the Scene) for suggestions on menu items and decorations.
Decide on your guest list and send out invitations. You will need between ten and twenty-five participants for your party to run properly. Refer to Chapter Four (under Invitations and Assigning Characters) for detailed information on assigning characters and issuing invitations.
The guide will walk you through all of these steps in detail, so don’t worry about getting to them yet.

taskList.title: Choose a date for your event
Brainstorm ideas for location, menu, and decorations (you will finalize these decisions later)
Come up with a guest list (more detailed instructions to come)

pageList.title: One Week Before Party
pageList.HTML:
The following steps should be taken one week before the party or immediately following the previous steps if the party is less than a week away.

Purchase any necessary supplies. If you require special decorations or ingredients for your menu, purchase them well in advance of your party date. Waiting until the day of or the day before an event will be more stressful and difficult than taking the time beforehand.
Verify attendance. Contact each of your guests beforehand and verify that they will be able to attend. If there are any last minute cancellations, you may need to bring in alternate players.
Prepare the paperwork. Print out copies of the character sheets, clues, voting sheets, and other relevant materials. Refer to Chapter Three (under Props) for specific instructions.
The guide will walk you through all of these steps in detail, so don’t worry about getting to them yet.

Prepare the Paperwork

pageList.title: One Day Before Party
pageList.HTML:
The following steps should be taken one day before the party (or ASAP if the party is today!).

Decorate your venue. Depending on the complexity of your decorations, you may wish to begin decorating your venue a full day in advance.
Begin preparing the food. Any food items that can be prepared in advance should be readied before the day of the party. While this will, of course, depend somewhat on your particular menu, ideally you should have everything ready to go in the oven or be set out on the table.
The guide will walk you through all of these steps in detail, so don’t worry about getting to them yet.

pageList.title: Day of Party
pageList.HTML:
The following steps should be taken on theday of the party.

Finish decorating. If there is additional decorating that needs to be done, try to do it several hours in advance of guest arrival; remember that some people may end up arriving earlier than you expect!
Finish preparing the food. If there are items that need to be cooked or prepared on the day of the party, have them ready to go before your guests arrive. Remember that once the party starts, you will have numerous responsibilities and will not be able to spend too much time in the kitchen.
Set out folders with character sheets and other prepared materials. Have all of your paperwork prepared and ready for distribution. Refer to Chapter Three (under Props) for details. Make certain that you have a copy of Chapter Five (Running the Party) on hand.
The guide will walk you through all of these steps in detail, so don’t worry about getting to them yet.

pageList.title: Guest Arrival
pageList.HTML: Once your guests begin arriving, use the “Party” section of the app to run the event. That section serves as a step-by-step manual that will walk you through the events that are to occur once the party begins.

pageList.title: Act 1
pageList.HTML:
Basic outline: This mystery is divided into two primary segments. 

Act One is the first portion of the evening, during which the guests will arrive at Francis Fisk’s penthouse apartment for a party in his honor. They will have a chance to eat, drink, and mingle with one another while acting in character. It is most important that the guests get to know each other’s characters during this part of the game, as knowing the details of the other players will be important to form a theory about the murder in Act Two. In this act, you will encourage everyone to introduce themselves to one another, ask about each other’s backgrounds, and share gossip. Additionally, several of the guests have certain personal goals (unrelated to the overall mystery) that they are attempting to achieve, and Act One gives them the opportunity to meet those goals. 

During the course of the evening, there are rolling blackouts that will be slowly approaching the Upper East Side. These are likely a result of power shortages in New York and the Head Caterer (played by the Host/Hostess) tells people not to worry. When the blackouts hit the penthouse, Francis Fisk is stabbed in the ensuing confusion.

pageList.title: Act 2
pageList.HTML:
Act Two will commence with the discovery of Francis Fisk’s corpse. He has been stabbed through the heart with something sharp. The Head Caterer will respond to the murder by calling the police. However, the elevator that leads to the apartment is not working due to the blackout, and the police cannot reach the penthouse until the power is restored. Until then, everyone is trapped, and they need to find the murderer or get caught in the inevitable scandal.

The rest of the evening is then devoted to locating clues, piecing together evidence, and trying to figure out who killed Fisk. The guests should hopefully determine that the killer is Zachary Wellington, the Architect, who killed Fisk over a personal vendetta (see Zachary’s character sheet for details). However, the night will include red herrings and misdirection that may lead them to point the finger at other guests. Those who correctly identify the killer will win an award at the end of the night.

pageList.title: Solving the Mystery
pageList.HTML:
There are several puzzles that the guests will need to piece together in order to solve the murder. They will find evidence such as Fisk’s corpse, Jo Chase’s camera footage, and the murder weapon, but solving the mystery will hinge on opening the safe and cracking Fisk’s cell phone. 

Here are notes about each piece of evidence:

Francis Fisk’s corpse: Francis has been stabbed in the heart by a sharp implement.
Bloody knife: Found in a wastebasket, it was obviously quickly discarded. The knife matches the set in the kitchen.
Jo Chase’s camera footage: The camera footage shows a male figure stabbing Fisk in the dark, but it is so grainy it’s difficult to tell who it is.
Fisk’s cell phone: The cell phone is cutting-edge technology and is down to its last bar of power. The players will only have time to examine three of the four recent e-mails and texts on the phone before it dies.
Phone call to the NYPD recorded earlier this morning; it lasted over thirty minutes.
E-mail to Jonathon Fisk about certain payouts on recent Ponzi schemes.
E-mail draft to Zachary Wellington titled “I know what you did to Gayle.”
A financial review of Rose den Waldern’s accounts that shows she has been rebuilding assets after taking a substantial loss in an investment. The investment is traced back to Jonathon Fisk.
Safe: The safe holds multiple files containing background information and secrets of several guests: the den Waldern’s, Fisk’s brothers, and Zachary Wellington. Fisk had a private eye investigate these people for various reasons:
Files on Rose den Waldern: This reveals through love letters that she was once a groupie for the band Eagle’s Rose in college and was going to run away with band member Grayson Kreig. However, her parents died shortly after. Receipts for a wedding ring are in this file. Also, there are some pictures of Rose and Grayson Kreig in a coffee shop that look recent. And a note from a private eye for a meeting earlier today.
File on Irene den Waldern: Mostly police records of public intoxication—one for public indecency and one for driving under the influence.
File on Richard den Waldern: Accounting files on notable contributions to children’s charities around the country. Also, admission papers to St. Albert’s Institution for attempted suicide. The file indicates that he was under watch for three months and then released.
File on Francine Rose: There are many pictures of her about town and a copy of a birth certificate. There is a note to contact the IRS about the birth certificate. File indicates she was living with Rose den Waldern’s cousin Stephan Transiv in Florida. There are pictures of Francine Rose in Florida, but she doesn’t look anything like the Francine Rose at the party.
File on Chester Fisk: These are mostly police reports on Chester’s past. He has multiple arrests for being drunk in public, possession, etc. In the past few years he appears to have cleaned up his act. There are financial notes on a hotel called the Castle. All the accounting notes are pristine.
File on Jonathon Fisk: The files on Jonathon are over ten years old, and all predate his assignment to Australia. There are several files with police records holding accusations of rape from numerous women. All the charges were dropped after substantial payouts. There are also financial records on Ponzi schemes that Fisk’s accountants apparently paid out before they were brought to police attention. There is an invoice from a private investigator to reopen the file on Jonathon that covers airfare to Australia and expenses. A meeting was scheduled tomorrow to discuss his findings.
File on Zachary Wellington: Mostly accounting records on his architecture business that Fisk recently took over and assimilated into his own company. Notes on employees, as well as an assessment of the company and suggestion for improving productivity. Also, an invoice from a private investigator for researching the death of Gayle Hartfort several years ago, dated before the takeover.
Culmination: At the end of the evening, the clues will be assembled and reviewed. Once the files from the safe are reviewed and the cell phone has been opened, the murderer will be revealed. Now partygoers will have the opportunity to cast their vote for who they think the killer is.

Awards: At the end of the evening, several awards will be presented to the guests. These awards are fully outlined in Chapter Five.

pageList.title: Required Male Roles
pageList.HTML:
Please note: This character list is for the Host/Hostess’s eyes only and should not be shared with the other players. An abbreviated guest list to be included with the invitations is provided in the handouts chapter (Chapter Seven).

Francis Fisk—Real Estate Tycoon—This party is being thrown by Francis in celebration of his company’s twenty-five years of success in real estate. Fisk is very wealthy and is using this party to announce his engagement to Rose den Waldern—in addition to celebrating the success of Fisk Enterprises. He is generally well liked by everyone. Francis always has to be in control. He has secret files on all the van Walderns and Fisks so that he can never be surprised by them. He is aware that Grayson Kreig and Rose den Waldern had a fling, but Rose has told him it’s over. To control his womanizing brother Jonathon, he sent him away to Australia, and he paid for brother Chester’s private education until Chester decided to invest in hotels. Whoever plays Francis Fisk during the first portion of the game will play Jess McIntire, one of the caterers, during the second portion.
Richard den Waldern—Philanthropist—A young but prominent philanthropist, he is known for giving generously to children’s charities around the country. He was recently committed to St. Albert’s Institution and put on suicide watch by his sister, Rose. He was released and told everyone he was visiting family in Florida. By happy coincidence, his cousin Francine came up from Florida, and he is using her as his cover story.
Chester Fisk—Playboy—The debauchery and indulgence of the life of the upper class run hand in hand with this well-known playboy and brother of Francis Fisk. He owns the Castle, a hotel known for ruining the reputations of many celebrities and socialites. However, recently he has begun a secret affair with Ashley LeBois and has stopped his debaucherous ways (at least in private).
Jonathon Fisk—Outcast—Jonathon runs Fisk Enterprises in Australia and has been invited back to New York for his brother’s big celebration. He was banished to Australia after he was accused of raping several women and his brother caught him running several Ponzi schemes with his money. While in Australia Jonathon continued his illegal activities and even fathered an illegitimate child. He desperately wishes to overthrow his brother by any means possible and return to New York.
Zachary Wellington—Architect—A board member of Fisk Enterprises from Chicago, he is attending the event with his daughter Candice. He married Francis’s ex-wife and then murdered her when she was about to leave him to return to Francis. Francis found this out many years later and took Zachary’s company from him in retribution. He informed Zachary before the party that he had alerted the NYPD and they would be standing by. Zachary is looking for a way to take revenge and pin it on another guest.

pageList.title: Optional Male Roles
pageList.HTML:
Male Roles: Optional

*Sam Lily—Lawyer—Entertainment lawyer known for his famous clients and sharp sense of humor. He knows a lot more about the partygoers’ legal histories than any of them know. He is having a secret fling with Helen LeBois, and the two are planning a quiet wedding.
*David Kreig—Author—He published a biting satire on Upper East Side personalities—recently at the top of the New York Times bestseller list—which everyone suspects is based on actual socialites. David attended the same prep school as most of the people here, but he came from a middle class family in Brooklyn and it practically bankrupted his parents to provide that future for him. But, he has turned all of his experiences there into literary gold.
*Grayson Kreig—Rock Star—A one-hit wonder, Grayson was once part of the band Eagle’s Rose, which has long since broken up. He was madly in love with Rose den Waldern, but she left him when her parents died to take care of her siblings. Recently, he met her again, and they have started a fling. He has come to the party to stop her from marrying Francis Fisk.
*Jesse Corrington—Journalist—Editor of a biting online gossip site, The Socialite, Jesse is known for only publishing verifiable rumors. He comes from one of the most powerful families on the Upper East Side but has always hated that his life has been planned out for him. He has made his break from them through founding his own website, which might be a bit of a rag, but it is enough to grant him his own independence.
*Isaac Corrington—Retired Senator—Although retired from government life, Isaac is the head of the politically active Corrington family. Easily the king of the Upper East Side socialites, Isaac had played the social and political scene for years. But now that he’s retired he’s looking out for the legacy of his family and wants to see his grandson Jesse take his place instead of running that yellow rag of a gossip website.
*Alexei Siranov—Security—Doorman and security for the party, Alexei is in charge of making sure none of the lower classes get into the party. He has a shady past with the Russian mafia but has been trying to clean up his act since he came to New York.

pageList.title: Required Female Roles
pageList.HTML:
Irene den Waldern—Party Planner—Party planner of the event with a party girl past she leverages to host only A-List parties. She lives a charmed life. Aside from some minor infractions in her youth everything she has ever wanted has been handed to her on a silver platter. She is the life of every party.
Rose den Waldern—Queen—Queen bee of the older socialites and older sister of Irene, Rose rules the Upper East Side with an iron fist inside a silken glove. She had a wild past and was madly in love with Grayson Kreig, but she left him when her parents died to take care of her siblings. She invested well and continued to support them. However, she recently got caught in a Ponzi scheme run by Jonathon Fisk and lost a great deal of money. She had her brother Richard committed to an institution after he continued to donate their money to charities. She does what she thinks is best for her family, no matter how hard-handed. She is engaged to Fisk because she thinks he will provide a good support for her family, even though she has fallen back in love with Grayson.
Jo Chase—Filmmaker—New to the scene, Jo makes documentaries and is filming as we speak. She wants to do an exposé on the secret lives of the Upper East Side and where better than at this party?
Candice Wellington—New Girl—Candice is both Zachary’s daughter and his assistant. This is her first time in New York. She is very nervous to be around the socialites but is determined to make a good impression for her father.

pageList.title: Optional Female Roles
pageList.HTML:
*Ashley LeBois—Editor—Up-and-coming queen of the younger generation, Ashley is the editor of Runway, a popular fashion magazine. She is a schemer and uses The Socialite to keep the younger generation in line. She is fiercely protective of her friends. She is the younger sister of Helen LeBois.
*Helen LeBois—Designer—Helen owns and designs her own line of haute couture fashion, catering only to the rich and fabulous. She is reserved and conservative, but has recently fallen deeply in love with Sam Lily, a lawyer from out West. It is very out of character for her, but she’s happy. She doesn’t want to create a scene and is planning to have a small ceremony soon.
*Gwen Kreig—Rising Star—New to the social scene, Gwen is a fashion designer with cutting-edge style and swift social climbing ambitions. She clambered to the top of the fashion scene after a scandal at Fashion Week caused by Ashley LeBois. While no one believed she wasn’t responsible, she was still smart enough to use the publicity to start her own line. Now she just needs some powerful backers. Gwen is the younger sister of David and Grayson.
*Francine (Frank) Rose—Debutante—A cousin of the den Walderns from Florida, Frank recently arrived in New York and is making her debut among the upper class. She is actually a fake, an actress from Florida who found out about the trust fund in the real Francine’s name and is trying to get Rose to grant her access to it.
*Mercy Neist—Scheming Socialite—A well-known socialite, Mercy mysteriously left New York a few years ago and has only just returned. She is a troublemaker and a schemer who used to give Ashley a run for her money. She has returned after the police dropped some charges and is eager to return to the scene.
*Davana Gudriov—Housekeeper—Ashley’s maid and housekeeper, Davana has been looking out for Ashley since she was a little girl. She knows a great deal about the secret goings-on of the Upper East Side but is fiercely loyal to the LeBois family.

pageList.title: Setting up the party
pageList.HTML:
As Host or Hostess, it is your responsibility to ensure that the mystery unfolds smoothly, that everyone is involved in the event, and that the location is set up in a fashion that lends itself to the story. While the party is designed to accommodate straight-from-the-box play with a minimum of set up and expense, you will find that a little bit of preparation will go a long way towards improving the overall experience. This chapter of the guide should give you some ideas regarding how to set up your party.

If you haven’t already, please choose a date for you party and enter it here.

This is also the time to come up with your guest list and brainstorm ideas for location, menu, and decorations.

taskList.title: Choose party date
Come up with a guest list

pageList.title: Setting the Scene
pageList.HTML: Murder in Manhattan is designed to be played in two acts, with Act One being the evening spent at Francis Fisk’s anniversary party while the guests attempt to uncover rumors and secrets about each other and Act Two being the time spent looking for the murderer. This party requires only minimal space and can be completed with very little in the way of decorations; a single large room for the main party can serve as the primary playing area with a small side room to serve as Fisk’s study. Of course, if you have more space available, you can designate several other rooms as part of the party, so that the guests can steal away to have private conversations. Ideas for other rooms include a game room, library, private balcony, or pool and garden area (if you have outdoor space to use).

taskList.title: Choose a location for the party

pageList.title: Menu
pageList.HTML: While five star restaurant food is a perfect choice for an Upper East Side soiree, it is difficult to come by. Be sure instead to have lots of upper class hor d’oeuvres on trays for casual sampling. Also have an ample supply of fake champagne and other virgin drinks available so your guests can always have a glass in their hands. Now is the perfect time to try some new virgin cocktail mixes so your guests can feel like real New Yorkers.

taskList.title: Plan the menu

pageList.title: Decorations
pageList.HTML: Decorations for the evening can be as simple or complex as you desire. If you want to go the distance, a web search for “New York benefits” or “Upper East Side party theme” will turn up numerous links to websites providing ideas. Subdued lighting, drapes to cover walls, and pictures of New York monuments may help immensely.

taskList.title: Finalize the list of decorations
Buy (or acquire) any decorations you don’t already have

pageList.title: Props
pageList.HTML:
While all the items that you need to play (invitations, nametags, character sheets, clues, voting sheets, and player awards) are included in this booklet for easy printing, more flavor can be added to the evening by taking a little extra time in preparing these necessities. Some possible suggestions include the following:

Invitations: Printing out the invitations on high quality stationary, vellum, or cardstock adds a touch of class and authenticity to your event.

Nametags: Most office supply stores carry a wide variety of plastic ID badge holders that are ideal for party nametags.

Character Sheets: These can be printed on plain paper. It is a good idea to have duplicates prepared in advance, as players have been known to misplace their starting materials.

Clues: Locating the clue cards during Act Two will be an integral part of solving the mystery. The game manual contains printed and pictorial representations of the clues that can be printed and used as is; it is recommended that these be printed on heavy cardstock, since the players will undoubtedly want to examine them in detail.

Player Awards: High-quality certificate paper is available at most office supply stores. Printing your player awards on this type of paper will give your guests a memento suitable for framing and display!

taskList.title: Make a list of any optional supplies you want to add into the game.
Purchase (or acquire) any props that are still needed

pageList.title: Audio
pageList.HTML: PWM Press offers several audio files for use with each of its mystery parties. The most recent version of these files (along with an instruction sheet that describes how to best make use of them) was included in your original download. Additionally, a sound track on loop for the party would add a feeling of class. Classical or understated modern music would work well, depending on the average age of your guests.

pageList.title: Candles
pageList.HTML: During the blackout scene, you have the option of providing guests with candles to add to the ambiance of the room. This scene is detailed in the party guide section titled “The Blackout”. If you choose to use candles, LED candles are safest and provide excellent ambiance without risk of fire.

pageList.title: Inviting Guests & Assigning Characters
pageList.HTML:
Inviting Guests & Assigning Characters

You will need to print out and send your invitations (along with RSVP cards, “What Is a Murder Mystery Party?” and the “Guest List” inserts) several weeks in advance of your event. The success of the party hinges on a minimum of ten participants (including the Host or Hostess) so it is very important that you verify attendance well before the actual event takes place; this will give you an opportunity to reschedule in the event that not enough players are able to attend.

 

Note that there are two types of RSVP cards available in your printable materials: the first type allows the Host or Hostess to choose the character the guests will be playing, and the second type provides an option for guests to indicate their character preference. Which type of RSVP card you use will be determined by how you want to assign characters, which will be discussed in the next step.

 

You have several options when it comes to assigning characters. You can assign characters yourself based on what you know about your guests and what roles you think they would enjoy, or you can allow your participants to choose their own characters on a first-come, first-served basis.

 

We recommend you choose to assign characters yourself (perhaps after discussing the available options with your players so that you can get a feel for what they would enjoy playing). This allows you to assign roles in a fashion that will keep the party running smoothly and will be enjoyable for all involved; for example, you may not want to assign an extremely outgoing character to someone who is particularly shy and introverted, since that person would likely to feel uncomfortable playing a character whose personality contrasts so drastically with their own.

If you opt to assign characters yourself, your invitation process should be as follows:

Step One: Contact prospective guests by phone, e-mail, or in person, explain that you will be hosting a Mystery Party, and verify their interest and availability. If you wish, you may choose to discuss available character options so that you have a good idea of what type of character each guest would like to play.
Step Two: Once you have established your guest list, print out and send out the formal invitations, along with the “What Is a Murder Mystery Party?” insert, the “Guest List” insert, and the first RSVP card (there is a field on this RSVP card that you can use to specify what character the guest will be playing).
Step Three: When you receive final confirmation via RSVP, send the guest his or her character sheet and rumor list. If you wish, you may instead choose to include the character sheet along with the original invitation; this works best if you know for certain each person you are inviting will definitely be attending.

pageList.title: Preparing the Scavenger Hunt
pageList.HTML:
A substantial portion of the night’s festivities will involve a scavenger hunt to locate the various clues that lead to the killer. There are four clues to be hidden, represented by paper tokens with a description and picture of the items, and locating them should take up most of the second half of the evening.

It’s best to hide the clues before the party starts if there isn’t a great risk of people finding them during Act One. Otherwise they can be hidden during the intermission between Act One and Act Two (if you can hide them without being seen). Either way make sure they’re hidden before you’re prompted to start the scavenger hunt, which begins starts shortly after the discovery of Francis Fisk’s dead body.

It is important you set up the clues in a way that will ensure the players are challenged but do not find it impossible to locate the objects necessary to make the event progress. Since you are just hiding paper tokens, there are many options for hiding places. Some hosts will tape the phone token to an actual phone, however it is just as appropriate to hide the token under a book or tape it to a wall. The locations of the clues do not have to be places that would be “realistic” for the story; the scavenger hunt simply represents the guests scouring for evidence. Accordingly, you can hide the clues anywhere that is part of the designated party area; they do not have to be in “the study” or any other specific room.

The four clue tokens that will be hidden for the scavenger hunt  are:

A Bloody Knife
Fisk’s Dead Body
Fisk’s Phone
Fisk’s Safe
Two of these clues will trigger further action once found:

Fisk’s Phone – When guests find the Fisk’s Cell Phone clue, read the phone token to the group and see if anyone says that they know how to get into the locked phone (a few can do it and should know to speak up; it’s a skill listed on their character sheets).
If at least one person speaks up, inform the group that the battery is almost dead and they only have time to look at three of the four clues. Shuffle the clues and ask the person who found the phone to select three of them and read them aloud to the group.
If no one speaks up, you will have to prompt Jonathon Fisk to announce that he knows how to unlock the phone. He is a required character with that ability, and it is critical that the phone be unlocked for the group to solve the mystery.
Fisk’s Safe - When guests locate the Fisk’s Safe clue token, you will read the clue token to the group and see if anyone speaks up about knowing how to open the safe (a few characters do).
If at least one person says they can open it, you will share the contents of the safe with the group. This means you can either read each of the file clue tokens out loud or pass the file tokens around to be read by the guests individually.
If no one speaks up, you will have to prompt Chester Fisk to announce that he can do it. He is a required character with that skill, and it is also critical that the safe be opened to solve the mystery.
Remember to be clear with your guests regarding the rules of finding the clues. If there are any places specifically off limits, point that out to the players and consider posting signs reminding them. Some good general rules for everyone to follow include:

Nothing is hidden inside something that needs to be disassembled in order to gain access; if you really feel that a hammer and screwdriver would be helpful in trying to find a potential token, you’re looking in the wrong place!
No tokens are hidden in a way that would require anyone to lift anything heavy or move anything especially delicate to find them.
No tokens are hidden in places that would be dangerous to reach or that would require guests to climb onto something.
No tokens are hidden in places that would require guests to get wet or dirty in order to reach them.
After the scavenger hunt has concluded and the clues have been shared with everyone, the group will have everything they need to solve the mystery. There should then be a period for everyone to discuss the new information and their ideas about who may have killed Francis Fisk.

pageList.title: Running the Party
pageList.HTML:
This section of the instruction manual, the Party Guidebook, contains a detailed script for running the party. You should print out this section in its entirety and have it on hand during the party; at various points you will need to read directly from this guidebook.

The following is an outline of each step found in the Party Guidebook:

Guest Arrival: Explains what you will need to do as the guests arrive for the party, before the actual game begins.
Introduction of the Guests: Provides a script for introducing the guests to the scene and explaining how the party will be run.
Act One: Covers the events leading up to the murder, including mingling, dinner, and the blackouts.
The Murder: Describes how to handle the actual murder of Francis Fisk.
Act Two: Covers the hunt for clues as the guests try to solve the murder.
Presentation of Evidence: Once all the clues have been found, the guests will have an opportunity to consider the different pieces of evidence they have gathered and present theories on the identity of the killer.
Votes: After all the evidence is considered, the guests will have an opportunity to vote on who they believe is the killer, as well as on which guests are the best dressed and the best at acting.
Revelation: Finally, once all the votes have been tallied, the actual killer will explain his actions, and the awards will be handed out.

pageList.title: Guest Arrival
pageList.HTML:
Starts: When all the guests have arrived.

Once everyone has arrived, it will be time to explain to them how the party will proceed. Read them the Welcome to the Party text below.

Welcome to the Party

Welcome, everyone, and thank you for attending Murder in Manhattan. As all of you know, this is a murder mystery party. During the party, each of you will be playing the role of a guest or employee of Francis Fisk at his party celebrating his company’s anniversary. You should each have a character sheet that details what your character knows and how you should act in specific situations. Aside from these instructions, there is no particular script you need to follow; simply do your best to act as you believe your character would act.

During the course of the event I will be playing the part of Taylor Walker, one of the caterers. However, I will also be available to answer any questions about how the game works. Just let me know if you need to ask me something “out of character.”

Your goal tonight is to get to know the other guests. Introduce yourselves, exchange backgrounds, and trade gossip. You should find there are some interesting secrets in the room. Maybe even a secret or two for which one would kill. This means pay special attention whenever you feel that a guest has something to hide. And more importantly, make sure to protect your own secrets. You don’t people drawing any unfavorable conclusions about you. Not in this prestigious crowd…

Each character sheet includes Gossip & Objectives pages that detail what you know about the other guests. Check your sheet before you start a conversation so you know with whom you’re dealing.

[Read following if you have less than 25 people or unassigned characters.]

Please note that there will be no one playing the following characters tonight and cross them off of your sheet anywhere the names appear.

[List the names of characters that are not being played by anyone]

You may hear these names in your conversations but you will not be interacting directly with those characters today.

Before we begin, we’ll give everyone a couple of minutes to read over your character sheets and make sure you understand everything. Remember not to show your character sheets to anyone else and to be careful with what information you end up sharing with other players. Most of you have secret information listed on your sheet your character wouldn’t want to disclose to just anyone. Please take a minute to read over your character sheets now.

[Once everyone has had a chance to read over their sheets, give them an opportunity to ask questions about how the game will work. Once all of their questions have been answered, continue this script.]

Alright, if there are no further questions, let me describe the scene for you. You are in Francis Fisk’s fabulous penthouse suite apartment on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. You are here for an evening of dinner, dancing, and conversation in celebration of the twenty-fifth anniversary of Fisk Enterprises. Francis Fisk has a big announcement to make at midnight, but everyone is free to mingle and talk until then.

[Point out each of the different rooms that are considered part of the game, and explain what part of the apartment they represent. You should have at least one large room for the dining hall and another that is Fisk’s study. You can specify other areas as you wish, depending on the size of the playing area.]

You are now free to mingle with each other and enjoy the party. Drinks and food will be available shortly. And now, if I could see the catering staff in the kitchen.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML:
You are Richard den Waldern, although everyone calls you Rick and you prefer it—Richard sounds so pretentious. You are Irene and Rose’s little brother and grew up in their shadow; they practically raised you after your parents died when you were young. You are a well-known philanthropist despite your youth, and you donate predominantly to organizations that help children. You feel that the scheming and glitteratti world of the Upper East Side robbed you of your childhood, and you want to make sure as many children have the opportunity for a good life as possible. After all, if your sisters used all the family’s money they would just buy shoes and dresses—better the money go to a good cause. You passionately want to make the world a better place and give generously whenever you’re asked. Your older sister Rose is the queen bee of the older socialites and has always been just as controlling of you as she is of the beautiful women of New York’s elite.

Recently Rose cut you off from the family money after a generous donation to Habitat for Humanity: Fund for Children. She said that you needed to grow up, get over your abandonment issues, and start adding to the family fortune instead of depleting it. You and she had a huge fight, after which you slit your wrists to get her attention. You didn’t mean to commit suicide; you just wanted her to take you seriously since nothing you said seemed to matter. However, things went a little too far, and she rushed you to the hospital. She then committed you to an institution named St. Albert’s without your consent and held you captive there for three months, all the while telling her social friends you were in Florida visiting family. She finally let you out after the doctors agreed you were on your way to recovery. You need to convince her that you should regain access to the family money without making a scene. You may not care so much about your family’s social ranking, but a scandal would make some charities less likely to accept your aid.

pages.title: Getting Into Character
pages.HTML: You are young and still slightly awkward. While your clothes are tailored, you don’t quite fit in them. This is your first party since being released from the institution, and you are nervous in large crowds. If anyone asks you about your philanthropic work you are VERY excitable and passionate.

pages.title: Gossip and Objectives
pages.HTML:
Mingling With Other Guests


You’ll find it beneficial to know as much as you can about the other guests as the game goes on. There are a lot of secrets out there, so use the mingling period to discover as many as you can. Even more importantly, make sure your own secrets stay hidden. Introduce yourselves to the other guests, ask about their backgrounds, give your own background (the best possible version, of course), and share gossip about the other attendees. Find out the story behind everyone’s story!
Please note that not all of the guests mentioned below may be in attendance. Your host or hostess will announce which guests are not in attendance. It is also possible that you may meet a guest who you know nothing about and who is not on your gossip list. How interesting! Should that happen, make sure to find out who they are and what they are doing at this party.

• Alexei Siranov is the doorman to Fisk’s building, and your sister hired him as security for the event since she thinks he might have Russian mob connections.
• Ashley LeBois is Irene’s best friend. She’s the editor of Runway, a popular fashion magazine and is “an evil dictator of taste.” She’s known for her impeccable good taste and harsh words to those who don’t meet her standards. She is the queen bee of the younger socialites and rules them with an iron fist. She is well known for leaking disastrous gossip to Jesse to post on his website—The Socialite—and uses it to keep her “minions” in line. She is forever scheming to maintain her status.
• Callaway Lee is your sister’s bartender.
• Candice Wellington is Zachary’s daughter and assistant. You have never seen her before in New York, but from the way she follows her father around it is apparent he is grooming her to take over his businesses.
• Chester Fisk, brother of Jonathon and Francis, acts like a playboy with vulgar and excessive tastes, but you have come to suspect that’s only a front. He has donated anonymously to several of your favorite charities. You only found out because some representatives contacted you to attend many parties he’s indirectly hosted to raise money.
• Davana Gudriov is Ashley’s housekeeper and practically raised her while her workaholic mother ran her business. The woman is kind and reliable but unfortunately usually gets caught up in Ashley’s schemes.
• David Kreig actually went to school with several of Irene’s crowd, but you don’t think they remember him since he was poor then and never went to parties. He recently published a wicked satire on life on the Upper East Side that you thought was incredibly accurate. You’re sure the vapid character Serella was based on Irene, and several of the other characters sound like her friends. You’re not in the book though, and you think David is a wonderful writer who deserves his hard-earned fame.
• Francine Thorne (whom you call Frank) is your cousin from Florida. She recently escaped her controlling father and has come to New York to live the life she always dreamed of. She graciously agreed to help you with your story concerning your “vacation.” Be sure to take her aside to make sure you both have your facts straight.
• Francis Fisk is the biggest name in high-end New York real estate and one of the richest men on the island.
He is the CEO of Fisk Enterprises and is solely responsible for his family’s immense fortune. A self-made man, he brought his younger brothers up from poverty.
• Grayson Kreig is David’s older brother and used to be a rock star. He had one hit song a few years ago and used it to weasel his way into polite society. You suspect he and Rose may be having an affair since she has his hit song on her ringtones: you heard it ring several times while you were in the institution.
• Gwen Kreig, David’s younger sister, was your best friend in grade school, but then she leveraged an internship with Helen to sabotage one of the shows and launch her own career. This backstabbing was the final straw in a pattern you saw. Sure enough, once she got her big break Gwen turned into a power-hungry socialista just like the rest of them. You haven’t spoken to her in months.
• Helen LeBois is Ashley’s older sister and a good friend of Rose. She designs clothes for the fabulously wealthy, since they’re the only ones who can afford them. She recently became engaged to Sam Lily. You found out because you saw him propose in a restaurant, but you don’t think anyone else knows.
• Irene den Waldern, your older sister, is a slightly reformed party girl. While she was there for you when you were “sick,” she was always being called away by her pointless job, catering to vapid celebrities. You think she just traded the wilder parties of her youth for the more upper class version, but she’s still the same old flaky Irene.
• Isaac Corrington is a retired senator who served for many years in Washington, D.C., and you believe he may be grooming his grandson Jesse to replace him. Isaac is known for controlling the future of his family. Look out for Jesse if you can: he deserves his own future.
• Jamie Lavigne is one of your sister’s caterers.
• Jesse Corrington: For a while you hoped your sister Irene would marry Jesse Corrington and settle down. But, like all her romances, it fell apart as soon as Jesse couldn’t devote all his time to her. Jesse’s gossip website has proven to be a weapon wielded by many on the Upper East Side, so be careful what you say around him.
• Jo Chase is a friend of David’s. You’ve heard she’s become a successful documentary filmmaker and is documenting New York life.
• Jonathon Fisk runs Fisk Enterprises in Australia. He has a rough past with his brother Francis and was banished from New York, but you don’t know the circumstances. Rumor has it he was worse than Chester in his youth.
• Mercy Neist used to be Irene’s other best friend, the wild opposite of Ashley’s refined tastes. She was the one who supplied Irene with drugs and led her on most of her wilder adventures. She left New York suddenly several years ago. You do not know why she has returned, but it surely involves trouble.
• Rose den Waldern is your other older sister. You are furious with her for cutting you off and then committing you against your will to a mental institution. She was always very controlling after your parents died, and although she practically raised you, that’s no excuse for her actions. Despite this you need her to give you access to the money again so you can continue to make the world a better place.
• Sam Lily is a celebrity lawyer who you think is engaged to Helen LeBois. You don’t know much about him beyond that he owns his own law firm.
• Sydney O’Connor is one of your sister’s caterers.
• Taylor Walker is your sister’s head caterer and is in charge of the help.
• Zachary Wellington ran his own real estate business in Chicago before it was acquired in a merger with Fisk Enterprises. Now he is on the board of Francis Fisk’s company.

pages.title: The Murder
pages.HTML:
Francis Fisk is dead! If you and the other guests cannot figure out who the killer is before the power comes back on then you will all be taken in to the police and embroiled in a great scandal. It could ruin your reputation, and you can’t have that.
During Act Two your primary objective is to piece together what happened to Fisk while keeping as many of your own secrets as quiet as you can. You know that you are not the killer, but that doesn’t necessarily mean you have nothing to worry about; if evidence seems to indicate that you committed the crime, the other guests may decide to turn you in to protect themselves! Make certain that you do everything possible to prove your innocence.

pages.title: Special Knowledge and Instructions for Act Two
pages.HTML:
You don’t want to cause a scandal during your sister’s party, so if any information comes up about you and your time in the institution try to downplay or hide it as best you can.
Many people will use this as an opportunity to cause a scandal and hurt each other. If you see this be sure to sigh and shake your head in disappointment. It’s so typical of these people to care nothing for anything but their own reputations.
If news about any engagement or hidden love comes out, be very supportive and defend people’s right to happiness. After all, there is so little of it in the world.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML:
You are Francis Fisk, host and murder victim (be sure not to let anyone know the latter). You are throwing this party to celebrate the twenty-fifth year of your successful real estate company, Fisk Enterprises, and to announce your engagement to the socialite Rose den Waldern. You were born in New York to a middle class family and got a scholarship to Brown. There you studied Business Management, and you applied yourself diligently when you returned. You founded your own company and through good business practices and sound investments have become one of the richest men in New York. You tried to bring your brother Jonathon in when you originally opened the company but the power turned out to be too much for him. He resorted to Ponzi schemes and the like to cheat money out of people. The final straw came when several women accused him of assault. He has always been charming and a ladies’ man, and you had had your suspicions, but public embarrassment was the last straw. Fortunately, he beat all the allegations. You opened a branch in Australia and sent him there. If England used it as a penal colony so would you. He has been quiet the past few years, and your business Down Under has grown so you felt that this anniversary was time for the two of you to reconcile.

Years ago when you were just starting your business you fell head over heels for Gayle Hartfort, a lovely socialite who played you like a fiddle. She cheated on you and one messy divorce later moved to Chicago where she married Zachary Wellington. A few years later you heard she had died and were shocked. You had put that behind you until one of your private eyes came to you and said he had heard rumors that Zachary Wellington had deliberately burned down that building with Gayle inside. Furious, you bought out his business in a vicious merger and put him on your board so you could keep an eye on him while your detective dug up more. He found a tape showing Zachary leaving the building that burned with a gasoline can in one hand. He locked the doors behind him. You have resolved to have Zachary arrested to exact justice and revenge! But it will wait until after your party; you don’t want to cause a scene and ruin your engagement announcement. Don’t mention anything about Zachary’s crime to anyone before then. You have a private detective on retainer and pay him well. You researched Rose and her family thoroughly so you would know what you were getting into with the marriage.

pages.title: Getting Into Character
pages.HTML: Although you came from the middle class you have impeccable taste and can afford the best suits so you wear them. This is your party so be sure to look dashing and powerful. You are a cold man; everything to you is a business transaction keyed to elevate your status. Be sure to keep all emotion off your face.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are Rose den Waldern, queen of the older Upper East Side socialites. Your mother was queen before you, a member of the prestigious Hartfort family, who have been members of the New York social scene since it was New Amsterdam. Your parents died when you were in college, cutting your wild indulgent lifestyle short, and you came home to raise your little brother and sister, who were still in grade school. You learned to be cold and practical, quickly earning the respect of the upper class and then taking control of the social scene to ensure your continued high station in the eyes of the New York elite. You have been married three times, once for love and twice for security. You are just as flighty as your little sister Irene but have learned to hide it to maintain your cool facade. When you were in college you were a groupie of Grayson’s band Eagle’s Rose and were madly in love with him. You were about to run away with him when your parents died and you had to come home. You control the family’s vast fortune with an iron fist, carefully seeding it through investments to ensure your continued lifestyle. Francis Fisk began courting you, and you saw the merging of your two fortunes as the perfect way to ensure the stability and security of the den Waldern name. However, in trying to learn more about his company you made an investment mistake encouraged by Jonathon Fisk that turned out to be a scam and lost over half your fortune before you managed to pull out. Your little brother’s philanthropic donations started to eat away more rapidly than you could fill the hole you had created, and you had to cut him off. You were devastated when he tried to commit suicide and blamed yourself. You institutionalized him in St. Albert’s for his own good and because they are known for their discretion. You have done your best to be an attentive and loving sister, while still refilling your bank account slowly. During this time you and Grayson reconnected. He found you crying in a coffee shop in Brooklyn where you went because no one would recognize you. You fell madly back in love with him and have been seeing him ever since. However, this complicates your engagement to Francis Fisk, who is the wiser choice between the broke musician and the successful businessman. However, you are a romantic at heart and have changed your cell phone ring to your favorite Eagle’s Rose song.

pages.title: Getting Into Character
pages.HTML: You are the perfect lady, elegant and poised. As queen bee of the older socialites you are always composed and charming. Be sure not to show too much emotion, and always be extremely polite. Veil your threats so they are not obvious. Your taste is conservative but fashionable. All these young people flashing their bare skin, they need to remember that what is hidden is what is desired.

pages.title: Gossip and Objectives
pages.HTML:
You’ll find it beneficial to know as much as you can about the other guests as the game goes on. There are a lot of secrets out there, so use the mingling period to discover as many as you can. Even more importantly, make sure your own secrets stay hidden. Introduce yourselves to the other guests, ask about their backgrounds, give your own background (the best possible version, of course), and share gossip about the other attendees. Find out the story behind everyone’s story! Please note that not all of the guests mentioned below may be in attendance. Your host or hostess will announce which guests are not in attendance. It is also possible that you may meet a guest who you know nothing about and who is not on your gossip list. How interesting! Should that happen, make sure to find out who they are and what they are doing at this party.

 

 

• Alexei Siranov is the doorman to Francis’s building.

• Ashley LeBois is Irene’s best friend and the up-and-coming queen bee of the younger socialites. Observe her shenanigans and only interfere if she threatens your position amongst the older socialites. Then teach her a lesson so she remembers you are still in charge.

• Callaway Lee is your sister’s bartenders.

• Candice Wellington is a sweet young girl who is new to New York and high society. Be sure to introduce her to your sister and her friends so she can start making inroads with the right people.

• Chester Fisk, brother of Jonathon and Francis, is a debaucherous playboy whose escapades have reached even your ears. When Francis announces your engagement you hope you can influence his wild ways.

• Davana Gudriov is Ashley’s housemaid and has come to help with the party.

• David Kreig recently published a book on the life of socialites on the Upper East Side that set all of Manhattan abuzz. Well, the younger generation anyway. However, he probably only wrote it because he is not a member, and when you’re on the outside all you can do is look inside and yearn.

• Francine (Frank) Rose is your late cousin’s daughter from Florida. She appeared in New York a few weeks ago, having run away from your controlling cousin-in-law, Stephan Transiv. You offered her shelter and promised to hide her from him. You are grateful she showed up when she did. She has been a huge comfort to Richard and will lend credence to your story that he was “on vacation in Florida” when you had him institutionalized. Be sure to introduce her around so she knows all the right people.

• Francis Fisk is the epitome of the Upper East Side elite. Even though he came from a poor family, he has been very, very successful and is also cultured and mannerly. You and he began dating several months ago, and things were going very well. He took you to all the best restaurants and shows, and you had rarely felt so pampered. He proposed to you romantically and is throwing this party so he can announce the news. However, you are not sure if you love him because your feelings for Grayson are so complicated.

• Grayson Kreig: You were madly in love with Grayson Kreig when you were in college and toured with his band Eagle’s Rose as a groupie. However, you had to leave him when your parents died to take care of your family fortune and younger siblings. You had heard his little siblings attended school with some of the younger generation but hadn’t seen him until recently. He came upon you crying over Richard in a coffee shop in Brooklyn, hiding your shame from the Upper East Siders. He comforted you, and it was as though no time had passed. His hit song is now the ringtone on your phone. Be sure to try and avoid him at the party; you mustn’t let Francis know of your indiscretions.

• Gwen Kreig is a talented young designer. You actually ran into her attending a function several years ago at Irene’s private high school and introduced her to Helen. Her career showed promise but then she entered into a petty war with Ashley for status amongst the younger generation. You were at the show on the front row (where else?) when her dress came out instead of Helen’s. The little backstabber used this to launch her own career. However, she has done very well for herself so her presence is tolerated as long as she behaves. Make sure you are polite to her even though she does not deserve your attention.

• Helen LeBois is an old friend of yours who designed her own incredibly successful fashion line. She has always been brilliant and shares many of your tastes. She’s never been as successful at love as you though, and you feel it’s time to find her someone to settle down with, so be sure to peruse the party for an eligible bachelor with the right qualities.

• Irene den Waldern is a lot like you when you were younger: wild and flighty. However, she did inherit your good taste and throws marvelous parties. Be sure to compliment her on this little soiree.

• Isaac Corrington, Jesse’s grandfather, is a recently retired U.S. senator and head of the prestigious Corrington family in New York. They are well known for their political power, and he rules them with an iron fist. He has uncanny business and political sense and is a delightfully subtle schemer. If you have an opportunity to get back at Jonathon for leading you astray, Isaac would be a good ally.

• Jamie Lavigne is one of your sister’s caterers.

• Jesse Corrington runs some gossip rag. Be careful around him. He comes from a good family, but one wrong word will have you splashed all over his website.

• Jo Chase is a documentary filmmaker Irene has allowed into the party. Filming the event is terribly gauche so make sure you avoid her, but always be poised if you are on camera.

• Jonathon Fisk runs Fisk Enterprises in Australia. You took his advice on an investment that turned out to be a Ponzi scheme, and you lost half of your fortune. You have not found a way to pay him back for this ruinous suggestion. Be sure to be completely polite and claim you recouped all your losses.

• Mercy Neist comes from a well-known family and was friends with Irene and Ashley in school. Unfortunately, she had some complications with the law in her youth and has only recently returned. Be sure to welcome her back to New York and ask how her travels were.

• Richard den Waldern: You feel terribly guilty about Richard and what happened to him. Be kind to him, but remember that a party is not the place to air your dirty laundry. Avoid talking money with him. He mustn’t know that you made a mistake or your control over your family might slip.

• Sam Lily is a rising star in the legal world. He owns his own law firm that caters to celebrities and the wealthy. However, he is new to New York, and you heard he was born on a farm in Ohio. While his status as a successful lawyer makes him worthy of attending parties with the Manhattan elite, it does not make him one of them.

• Sydney O’Connor is one of your sister’s caterers.

• Taylor Walker is your sister’s head caterer and is in charge of the help.

• Zachary Wellington is a successful real estate investor from Chicago. He used to live in New York and you dated him after college. However, he left the city and was briefly married in Chicago. His wife died in a building fire, and he was left with his daughter Candice. Francis recently bought his company in a ruthless takeover. You think he keeps him on his board just so he can keep an eye on him

pages.title: Special Knowledge and Instructions
pages.HTML:
• Your fiancé is dead! Well, it might be terribly gauche, but you didn’t really love him and now you can be with Grayson. However, revealing it now would only add to the scandal of the murder (and might lead others to suspect that you committed the crime), so be sure to keep it under wraps.

• You don’t want ANYONE to find out about Richard’s time at St. Albert’s, so be sure to keep an eye on him.

• This is the perfect opportunity to get back at Jonathon Fisk for involving you in a Ponzi scheme. Any dirt you can dig up on him to undermine him
and get back the money he stole from you would be a grand coup.

• You are still the queen. Be sure to be a cool head in this situation and control the crowd. This is such a potentially huge scandal you need to control how it breaks.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are Ashley LeBois, member of a prestigious family, editor of a famous design magazine, and sister to the owner of a fabulous design company. Your life is the envy of all the Upper East Side socialites, and you bask in your perfection. However, you have a dark secret: you have been seeing Chester Fisk on the sly. You ran into him at a nightclub opening, and for just one moment you let your pristine mask slip and gave in to a bit of indulgence. That bit became a bite, which became a slice, and sooner than you knew you had bitten off more than you could chew. You discovered that Chester’s whole playboy attitude is a front for a shrewd but caring young man. You are terrified that you are falling in love with him. You have been best friends with Irene den Waldern since grade school and have always felt as though you were in her shadow. You fought, clawed, backstabbed, and schemed your way to be queen of your prep school and the Manhattan socialites, but everything has always just fallen into Irene’s lap freely and without effort. You stalked the previous editor of Runway relentlessly until she hired you, and then you applied your sharp social skills to climbing the business ladder, which you did with poise, keeping your poison tongue discreet but just as sharp. Runway caters to the socially elite and you only publish fashion and cutting edge design. You would never use your prestigious pages for tawdry gossip. Plus it could be linked to you.

pages.title: Getting Into Character
pages.HTML: As the editor of a fashion magazine you wear only the latest fashions, so cutting edge you might be falling of the fashion cliff. Be sure to wear something innovative you can flaunt over the other girls and hint that you might be able to get them one for a favor. If anyone acts up it is your duty as up-and-coming queen bee to remind them you are in charge. You are fiercely loyal to your friends and will defend them in the most conniving ways possible.

pages.HTML:
You’ll find it beneficial to know as much as you can about the other guests as the game goes on. There are a lot of secrets out there, so use the mingling period to discover as many as you can. Even more importantly, make sure your own secrets stay hidden. Introduce yourselves to the other guests, ask about their backgrounds, give your own background (the best possible version, of course), and share gossip about the other attendees. Find out the story behind everyone’s story!


Please note that not all of the guests mentioned below may be in attendance. Your host or hostess will announce which guests are not in attendance. It is also possible that you may meet a guest who you know nothing about and who is not on your gossip list. How interesting! Should that happen, make sure to find out who they are and what they are doing at this party.

• Alexei Siranov has been the doorman to Fisk’s building for years, and you have frequently seen him with tough-looking men. You suspect he has Russian mob ties, although you do not have any proof: he has always been very discreet.

• Callaway Lee is Irene’s bartender. The upper class often ignores the help, but you know they hear more than they should. Be careful around them, and be sure to grill them if you think they overheard anything.

• Candice Wellington is Zachary’s daughter and new on the New York scene. Be sure to take her under your wing.

• Chester Fisk (Jonathon and Francis’s brother) is a no-good, manipulative playboy, and you are falling hopelessly in love with him. His mind is just like yours—always on the move, always ten steps ahead of the game, which he plays flawlessly. He’s like your other half. Of course, his reputation is utterly incompatible with yours, so be sure not to let anything slip. Maintain appearances, but find time to slip away with him if you can.

• Davana Gudriov is your housekeeper and has been a factor in your life ever since you were a child. She always plays a part in your schemes and frequently covers for you. You often ask her for advice, and she gives it freely, often with anecdotes from “the Old Country.” She practically raised you, and you love her like family, although you will always think of her as “help.”

• David Kreig is a thorn in your side. You vaguely recall seeing him when you were in prep school, but he wasn’t a member of the social elite so he mostly passed beneath your notice. And then he published that book, Looking In. All of the Upper East Side bought it to see if they were in it, and you suspect you were. There is a character in there named Clair, a manipulative, weaseling anti-heroine who ends up sleeping with the protagonist, a young man of the lower class trying to move up the social chain. As if you would EVER slum it in Brooklyn! Find out if that character is you, and if she is, find some way to make him pay for using you and your story to bribe his way into the Manhattan social scene.

• Francine (Frank) Rose is Irene’s cousin from Florida. She supposedly spent a lot of time with Richard, so be sure to grill her about their time. She’s new to New York. Take her under your wing and teach her what it means to be one of the players in your court. She should know your rules before she breaks any.

• Francis Fisk is a well-groomed and powerful member of the New York social elite. Fisk Enterprises owns some of the largest and most well known high rises in New York, and practically everything he touches turns to gold. He also wants to make an announcement at midnight. Try to find out what it is. You hate surprises.

• Grayson Kreig had a hit song a million years ago. How on earth did he get into this party? • Gwen Kreig is worse than her brother. In prep school you saw potential in this shy girl from Brooklyn and took her under your wing, teaching her where to shop, who to be seen with, and how to act. She is an extremely talented designer and interned with your sister. Helen was so smitten by her talent that she began to rely heavily on her, and you and your opinions fell to the wayside. To make your sister pay you switched one of her dresses with one of Gwen’s designs. This ended up launching Gwen’s career but ruined her standing in good society. Do NOT admit to this. Gwen is an upstart and you are queen. You refuse to wear her beautiful designs out of sheer stubbornness and take every opportunity to jibe that Runway will NEVER display her designs since yours is the only opinion that matters in the New York fashion world.

• Helen LeBois is your older sister and a fabulous designer. You have featured her many times in your magazine. You are fiercely devoted to her and brook no upstarts to her position amongst the socialites, like that conniving Gwen Kreig. You have always participated in her show at Fashion Week, and it is one of your most treasured childhood memories.

• Irene den Waldern may not be queen, but she is the darling of the New York elite. She is poised without trying, perfect without striving, and everything always goes well for her. You have been her best friend since you both got Manolos, but you have always been in her shadow. While she may be hosting this party you are still the queen on your turf; make sure she knows it if anything goes wrong.

• Isaac Corrington, Jesse’s grandfather, is a retired U.S. senator and one of the highest ranked of the old New York elite. Be sure to be very respectful and poised around him. One word from him could threaten even your throne.

• Jamie Lavigne is one of Irene’s caterers. The upper class often ignores the help, but you know they hear more than they should. Be careful around them, and be sure to grill them if you think they overheard anything.

• Jesse Corrington is an old flame of yours. You were passionately in love in prep school but then he left you for Irene. He owns and operates The Socialite, a web magazine full of the gossip and lies of the Upper East Side. You wield his site like a weapon amongst the socialites and have posted anonymously to it hundreds of time, using it as an engine of destruction against any who challenge your position.

• Jo Chase is a filmmaker or something. Irene is apparently letting her film the party for a documentary on the New York elite. Be sure to put your best foot forward when you’re on camera. But, if something should slip, make sure that camera does not leave the penthouse.

• Jonathon Fisk runs Fisk Enterprises in Australia. You have heard that his past was much like Chester’s and that Francis sent him to Australia to get him out of the States.

• Mercy Neist used to be your and Irene’s best friend. She was always the bad girl, and partying with her always brought out Irene’s wilder side. The stories she could tell would drive you to social oblivion. She had to leave the States due to drug charges and has recently returned. Keep an eye on her. She is a mischief maker on par with you. If she gets too out of hand, see if you can’t have the police reopen her case. Nothing says queen like banishing a competitor.

• Richard den Waldern is the youngest of the wealthy den Walderns and the most naive. He has always been a nice boy but tends to give a lot to charity. You heard he went away to Florida recently. Irene was very concerned so you suspect something is afoot. Do your best to find out what.

• Rose den Waldern is good friends with your sister Helen and is the queen of the older socialites. While you admire her sharp wit and ruthless skill, she is a little old fashioned for your taste. She thinks the Socialite is a crass rag and does not see all of its potential to control the socialites. You know she is utterly ruthless and will do anything to achieve her ends, even against her own family.

• Sam Lily is an up-and-coming lawyer in New York. You actually featured him in your magazine in a spot on “Most-Eligible Bachelors.” He’s well groomed and polite, but too folksy for your taste. He grew up on a farm somewhere in the Midwest, went to school at Harvard, and then established himself in New York. Still, he is very handsome. See if you can introduce him to some of the young ladies. It would be nice to do a continuation piece on “New York Marriages.”

• Sydney O’Connor is one of Irene’s caterers. The upper class often ignores the help, but you know they hear more than they should. Be careful around them, and be sure to grill them if you think they overheard anything.

• Taylor Walker is Irene’s head caterer. The upper class often ignores the help, but you know they hear more than they should. Be careful around them, and be sure to grill them if you think they’ve overheard something.

• Zachary Wellington is a Fisk Enterprises board member from Chicago. Something about him rubs you wrong, you just can’t put your finger on it. Be sure to find out as much about him as possible.
