pages.HTML:
• You cannot BELIEVE this all happened! This is the scandal of the century, and you’re at ground zero. Be sure to enlist Davana to aid you in gathering information and controlling its flow.

• Do not let Gwen Kreig ruin your relationship with your sister with her vicious rumors. What you did was petty, and you know it now.

• If anyone tries to hurt the den Walderns, be sure to take them down quickly and publicly. No one can take a swing at Irene’s family but you.

• You are an expert with cell phones. If one needs to be unlocked, step up. You know how to open them like no one else.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are Helen LeBois, a self-made businesswoman who creates and produces her own fashion line. You have stores in New York, London, and Paris, and you earn every cent you make. You are longtime friends with Rose den Waldern and have stood by her side through her many marriages and subsequent divorces. Although you came from a wealthy and well-known family, you take pride that you are wealthy on your own, and you do your best not to disturb the family money, which is growing well in many investments. You are always looking for new stable investment opportunities. Your fashion line is very popular amongst the social elite, which is good since only they can afford it. Your little sister Ashley is following in your footsteps. Although she never had the eye for design, she has exquisite instinctive fashion sense, which has served her well. You recently became involved with Sam Lily, a wealthy celebrity lawyer who was defending a client you were dressing for an awards show. Despite your wildly different backgrounds the two of you hit it off. pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are David Kreig, author of Looking In, a biting satire on the life and lies of the Upper East Side socialites. Everyone there knew you were poor, and they treated you like gum on their Prada shoes. You studied hard and got into Yale. There you entered the writing program, and your professors told you to write what you knew. So you did. Overnight you became famous and every single member of the New York snobbery had bought your book, wondering if they were in it. The main characters are loosely based on the younger socialites: Serella is Irene, Clair is Ashley, James is Jesse, and Charles is Chester. But there are plenty of other influences as well, and the characters are exaggerated to make them more satirical.

pages.HTML: You are Gwen Kreig, a very popular young designer whose meteoric rise has been noticed by many of the Upper East Side royalty. If they’re not wearing your clothes, then their children certainly are. You have two lines: one is very upper class punk, and the other is sleek and sophisticated. You are one of the youngest people in attendance here tonight, but you have accomplished more in your few years than most in a lifetime. You went to prep school with many of the young socialites and became enamored with the glamour of their lifestyle. You convinced Ashley LeBois to take you under her wing even though your parents are poor and from Brooklyn. She treated you like a slave, sending you to run errands and involving you in her schemes to punish people she felt had slighted her. You got an internship with her older sister and were introduced to an even more beautiful world—so much bigger than your little sewing machine. You worked tirelessly for her but started to feel that she was taking advantage of your talents. Then one day, for no reason, Ashley threw a fit at Helen’s Fashion Week show and switched one of the model’s dresses with one of yours. Your dress came down the runway to thunderous applause, and the resulting scandal removed you from social prominence with surgical precision. Grayson suggested you use the news buzz generated from the show to launch your own career, so you did. Investors took notice, and soon offers were pouring in. Within weeks you had a work space, cloth, and people to help you. Your clothing line has been in your own private store for three years now, and you’ve made enough money to pay back your investors and start making money of your own. What you really need now is some good publicity to launch you out of New York. You’d like to make your brand national.

You have a wild past of partying and drug use but have put those days behind you in an effort to become a successful businesswoman. You have never married but have a string of boyfriends and broken hearts behind you. Even though you pledged eternal love to all your paramours, you were always too much of a free spirit to really settle down. Your last long-term relationship was with Jesse Corrington, but he was too obsessed with his work to pay enough attention to you, so you broke it off. You currently work at a famous public relations firm in Manhattan that specializes in celebrities and movie promotions. You use your status among New York’s upper crust to throw fabulous parties for your firm: your very presence ensures an A-list crowd. Francis Fisk, one of the wealthiest men in New York, asked you to throw this party for him in celebration of his company’s twenty-fifth anniversary.

Rose told you to tell everyone he was visiting family in Florida, so as to avoid a scandal. This party is his first since his “vacation.”

pages.HTML: You are Jesse Corrington, the legacy of the powerful Corrington dynasty of New York City. Your whole life was planned out for you as soon as you were born. You skated through class staring out the window but still getting good grades because your grandfather donated obscene amounts of money to your school. Then you applied to a few extra colleges beside the Ivy Triumvirate on a whim. To your surprise, you got in. You bucked your grandfather’s insistence and your family’s expectations and left for the West Coast. There you studied journalism and social sciences. When you returned to New York you were a changed man. You decided that since you could never really leave the world of backstabbing socialites, that you would do your best to make them fear you. You took over the aging newspaper The Socialite and turned it into a web-based magazine that allowed anonymous posting. What makes you different from the other gossip sites is that you require photographic proof to all posts. Your site is wildly popular amongst the younger generation of socialites and has given you a mantle of power. No one wants to make you angry or double deal with you because you effectively hold the database of all their secrets. For the first time ever you are in control of your own life.

• Francis Fisk is the host of this party and a very successful businessman. He is normally too boring to end up on your site, but you got a tip a week ago that said he was looking at diamond rings. You would not release the information without knowing the identity of the bride, but you’d be willing to bet your penthouse he’ll be announcing the engagement at this party. • Grayson Kreig, David & Gwen’s brother, used to be a rock star, you think. But it was so long ago, who cares?

• Gwen Kreig, David’s younger sister, used to be one of Ashley’s minions at school. She did everything from fetch Ashley’s lunch to take out her dry cleaning. • Helen LeBois, Ashley’s older sister, is a famous designer whose clothes have been featured multiple times on Runway. That sort of favoritism is why you despise New York socialites. Whatever happens, don’t let him persuade you to do anything; everything he does is a scheme to put you in his power.

• Jamie Lavigne is a caterer.

• Jess McIntire is a caterer with a criminal juvenile record. He robbed a gas station at knifepoint as a thirteen year old. You have promised to pay him $500 for any rumors he brings you. Also, if he lies to you, you will reveal his record and make sure he never works high society events again.

• Jo Chase is a documentary filmmaker whose films are often sold to public television. She’s here filming the party. If anything interesting happens be sure to get a copy of the footage so you can upload it to your site.

• Jonathon Fisk just returned from Australia. Your posters caught his arrival on “Sighted” and report seeing >him meet with Zachary Wellington on several occasions.

• Mercy Neist was best friends with Ashley and Irene in prep school. She was responsible for many of Irene’s darker transgressions and was arrested with her on some minor narcotics possession charges. Every time, they got off with a slap on the wrist, but then Mercy was charged with intent to distribute and had to flee to Europe. She just returned so the charges must have been dropped. He recently went to Florida to visit relatives and came back with his cousin, Francine Thorne. However, your “Sighted” feature (which allows people to post where they’ve seen prominent socialites) did not track his leaving or return to the city. Odd, your little birds are normally very thorough in their documentation of the prominent den Waldern family.

• Rose den Waldern is the head of the den Waldern family and queen of the older socialites. Her heyday was before your site opened so you do not have much posted about her. She has been seen in some off locations, though. She was “Sighted” going into and out of St. Albert’s, a mental institution known for its discretion. She has also been seen getting out of her Town Car in Brooklyn. However, you have not posted these tidbits publicly yet since they by themselves are not scandalous. • Sydney O’Connor is a caterer.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are Isaac Corrington, a retired U.S. senator. You were raised to believe that it was your duty to do what was necessary to further the name of your family. Your father had a rich legacy he passed on to you, along with a vast fortune. Just as he did, you have ensured that your family remains one of the most powerful families in New York, if not the United States. Under your watchful eyes your sons and daughters grew up to be senators, governors, and very successful business owners, all adding to the family name and its prestige. You believe in keeping business within the family and not airing your dirty laundry in public. As such you have a powerful PR machine behind you and have bought and sold many of the New York socialites with large sums of money you treated like chump change. While in the Senate you backed the deregulation of business so that your family could grow and expand. And then one of your most promising grandchildren, Jesse, whom you thought would one day make an excellent senator, maybe even president, decided he wanted nothing to do with his family’s long and proud history. His rebellion infuriated you, and you cut him off from family money and then tried to manipulate him back into the fold. He dodged your every attempt, something which made you proud yet was also very vexing. When Jesse returned to New York after attending college on the West Coast (when he could have gone to Harvard!), he started some ridiculous gossip rag all the young people are obsessed with. This is no worthy endeavor for someone with your name. He should be running the city, not trading in petty secrets. Your goal at this party is to show him that he does not have true power and should come back to your vision of his future. Use whatever means necessary in your scheming.

pages.title: Getting Into Character
pages.HTML: You are the oldest person at this party so run some aging powder through your hair to give yourself a dignified look. Maybe even a little age makeup. Be sure to dress very well. You are the richest person in attendance and like to remind people of that by wearing only the finest clothes.

His hotel is responsible for many of the scandals you have had to squash in the past few years. If you can find an opportunity to shut him down take it; that boy is more trouble than he’s worth.

• Davana Gudriov is Ashley’s housekeeper.

• David Kreig wrote some book that has made him famous.

• Francine Thorne is a cousin of the den Walderns from Florida. She is new to New York.

You greatly respect him for making a name for himself, and he has excellent taste for someone not born into high society.

• Gwen Kreig is a designer, you hope; it would explain that dress she’s wearing.

Perhaps she would be willing to talk to him if you promised her business from some of your more prominent family members.

• Jamie Lavigne is a caterer.

• Jesse Corrington is your grandson and was a very promising young man until he decided to turn away from your plans for him. Since then he’s steeped himself in the low-life gossip of the socialites and published their rumors on the Internet. Make him see the error of his ways.

• Jo Chase must be a filmmaker due to her camera. How did she get in here?

• Jonathon Fisk is Francis’s younger brother. Where Francis has excellent business sense, Jonathon is more likely to be involved in the seedier sides of business dealings. Year ago, he was accused of assaulting a young woman and of being a party to some business transactions that read more like con jobs, after which his brother sent him to run Fisk Enterprises in Australia. You believe he has continued his misdealings down under. What can Francis be thinking, bringing him back here?

• Mercy Neist used to attend prep school with Jesse but just recently returned from Europe.

• Richard den Waldern is a philanthropist who mostly supports children’s charities.

• Rose den Waldern is the socialite queen of the Upper East Side. She is on countless charity boards and wields her power like a true dictator, an iron hand in a silken glove. While you think her scheming a bit below you—her machinations don’t hold a candle to the scheming required for success in politics—you still respect her as a businesswoman.

• Sam Lily is a fast-rising lawyer specializing in celebrities and movie stars. A few of your family have used him to great success.

• Sydney O’Connor is a caterer.

• Taylor Walker is head caterer.

• Zachary Wellington is a real estate mogul from Chicago, and his firm was recently bought out in a brutal acquisition by Fisk Enterprises. Fisk made him a board member to keep an eye on him. His only living family is his daughter; her mom died in a mysterious fire in one of his old buildings.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are Chester Fisk, the self-proclaimed playboy debonair of the Upper East Side. Your brother Francis made his fortune when you were very young, and all your life everything you have ever wanted has been provided for you on a silver platter. As a teenager you indulged yourself to extremes, sampling everything your money could buy you—drugs, alcohol, women, gambling, wild parties, etc. However, you had an epiphany: as a playboy no one ever took you seriously. You decided to start building your own empire, separate from the shadow of your older brother. You started with the “Castle,” a run-down, dilapidated hotel you renovated and turned into the playhouse for the Upper East Side’s fantasies. You regularly throw parties where “anything goes” is an understatement. All the publicity has kept all your rooms booked, and you are quietly making a fortune. With that fortune you have been buying nightclubs and restaurants and donating to charities, all as discreetly and anonymously as possible so as not to soften your hard-earned reputation as a ne’er-do-well. You love the secrecy and romanticism of the 1920s to 40s, and many of your clubs have a speakeasy theme to add an air of mystique to them. All of them have been doing very well, and you are looking to expand into other cities. Chicago would be perfect, due to its mobster history. You recently seduced Ashley LeBois; it started as just another conquest but she has proven interesting and delightful. Enough so that you stopped your other entertainments. You’ve even been looking at engagement rings.

pages.title: Getting Into Character
pages.HTML: Be sure to play up the indulgent playboy aspect as much as you possibly can. You wear well-tailored, old-fashioned suits, giving you somewhat the air of a mobster. Your favorite color is purple so be sure to wear it on your tie, shirt, or accessories. You love lush fabrics; feel free to go over the top in this regard.

• Alexei Siranov is the doorman at Fisk’s building. You have seen burly Russian men around him and suspect he may have some ties to the mob. • Ashley LeBois is the manipulative queen of the Upper East Side socialites. She schemed and clawed her way to the top, and she’s earned her position. One night at one of your parties you saw her cut loose, and you were entranced by her. You seduced her and have been continuing this passionate affair ever since. She is terrified people will find out and that it will ruin her hard-won reputation. You are happy to indulge her, and yourself, for the time being. No need for her to see what a romantic you truly are; that can wait for when she comes around and your empire is in place.

• Callaway Lee is a bartender. Taylor also moonlights at your club.

• Candice Wellington is Zachary’s daughter, and he appears to be grooming her to take over his business interests.

• Davana Gudriov practically raised Ashley, and after Ahsley moved out on her own, she retained Davana as her housekeeper. Davana knows all of Ashley’s secrets and is always used in her schemes. However, the woman is as hard as Russian ice and fiercely loyal to Ashley, so she is unlikely to crack.

• David Kreig recently published a book on the Upper East Side, and it is obvious to you that you are the playboy Charles. You don’t mind; all publicity is good publicity as far as you’re concerned.

• Francine Thorne is Irene’s cousin from Florida and looks ripe for the picking. Be sure to invite her to your hotel so you can find out what her poison is.

• Francis Fisk is your older brother and made the fortune you abused so thoroughly when you were younger. You want to support him in his hour of triumph, and you have heard him talking about a woman he wants to marry. Francis has never been a very emotional man and tends to view life as a series of business transactions. Find out if he truly loves this woman or if this is just another deal to enhance his standing.

• Grayson Kreig—Who?

• Gwen Kreig, David’s sister, is a popular fashion designer amongst the younger crowd, and many of your clients wear her clothes. You like her punky style, even though you prefer something a little more old fashioned. She used to be one of Ashley’s girls in prep school but then caused a scandal at one of Helen’s shows during Fashion Week. That sort of deviousness sounded more like Ashley to you, but you have no proof and don’t care either way.

• Helen LeBois is a stuck-up designer who thinks her clothes cover gods. You have always disliked her and her desire for perfection. It is the imperfections that make people beautiful, not the lack of them. But she is Ashley’s sister, and you want Ashley to be happy, so be sure to pull in your claws.

• Irene den Waldern used to be a party girl back in school, and she was a beautiful disaster. She had the uncanny ability to avoid trouble; things just always seemed to work out in her favor. Since then she has joined a PR firm, and your hotel has caused several scandals she has worked hard to dissipate. Be sure to offer your apologies for all the trouble you have cause her clients as sarcastically as possible.

Still, it’s not like they were there under duress. And you didn’t sell them the hookers and blow; you just provided the rooms.

• Jamie Lavigne is a caterer. Taylor also moonlights at your club.

• Jesse Corrington was a friend of yours in prep school. His family basically spelled out his life for him, but he rebelled and went off the school on the West Coast. You thought it was the right thing for him to do; he came back his own man instead of just another cookie-cutter Corrington. Also, his gossip website, The Socialite, is one of your best PR machines. You’re reasonably sure it’s responsible attracting the young crowd to your hotel and parties.

• Jo Chase appears to be a filmmaker. Be sure to show off for her and see if you can’t push your indulgent reputation a bit further. You never know where her footage might show up. • Jonathon Fisk is your older brother and a true scoundrel. When you were young he helped Francis run Fisk Enterprises, but the power went to his head. He became obsessed with and stalked and assaulted several women. He was accused of shady deals, and Francis sent him to Australia to get him away from the family. While Down Under he’s done alright for Fisk Enterprises, but you still hear he is continuing more of his bad business. Be careful around him; he may try to usurp your investments if he finds out about them.

• Mercy Neist was best friends with Ashley and Irene in prep school. She was by far one of the wildest and most merciless people you have ever met. The girl was a walking scandal. She always knew where the parties and the drugs were. Ashley used to call her her “hitman” and would turn her loose on girls who disputed her reign at school. One night she went too far and was caught with a bunch of pills. Her parents got her out on bail, but you found out she was going to be arrested again on felony drug charges and warned her. She fled to Europe and remained there, partying just as hard as ever. She’s amassed a fortune by marrying and then divorcing rich Europeans. Recently the charges against her were dropped, and she’s returned. Be careful around her. She could be a great addition to your hotel staff if she’s mellowed a bit, but her schemes tended to be very malicious, which could damage your hotel.

• Richard den Waldern is a kind soul trapped in a cruel world. He has recommended several charities to you to donate to, often under the pretext of “redeeming” you. Unbeknownst to him you have often contributed to them generously.

• Rose den Waldern is a powerful socialite with a checkered past. You would have liked to have known her when she was younger, when she was a groupie for some forgotten rock band. Now she is a waspish control freak who runs her family like a well-greased wheel.

• Sam Lily is a rising star in the legal world, and your hotel has been investigated by his firm more than once when one of their clients was not as discreet as they should have been. You’re very experienced at this game and are always helpful, but you don’t reveal too much. He can talk to your lawyers.

• Sydney O’Connor is a caterer. Taylor also moonlights at your club.

• Taylor Walker is a caterer Irene hires a lot. Taylor also moonlights at your club.

• Zachary Wellington is a businessman much like Francis—but from Chicago. Francis was briefly married to a woman named Gayle Hartfort but got divorced. The woman broke his heart and then married Zachary. After she gave birth to Candice she died in a fire in one of Zachary’s buildings. Francis just recently acquired Zachary’s business in a hostile takeover he said was personal. Try to find out more about what happened.

• Ashley is a natural at manipulating people. Be sure to put your heads together and come up with a plan to locate the murderer by any means necessary. Whoever did this needs to pay.

pages.title: Who You Are
pages.HTML: You are Jonathon Fisk, a disillusioned con artist masquerading as a businessman. Your brother Francis has always eclipsed you. In school he had the best grades and won every prize. He won the scholarships that sent him to Brown. He made a fortune before he was thirty—the list goes on and on. Fortunately for you, he was naive and put the money in a fund you could access and made you his partner. With all this money you could do whatever you >wanted. Your misdealings started out small, but over the years you developed several Ponzi schemes to pad your own pockets. You’ve also always had a thing for hard partying, but when you get drunk, you tend towards violence. This has resulted in some serious legal charges in the past. Francis found out about your double-dealings, banished you to Australia to run his company’s dealings there, and cut you off from all his personal money. You figure he considered that part of the company too small to make you any threat to him. You continued your ways, which led to a string of settled lawsuits from women you wronged and even one who bore your son. You paid her off, of course, so you could continue your life in what passes for Australian high society. You did your best to run the company there, but you have always been on the lookout for chumps. Recently you were approached by Rose den Waldern, who you knew from New York. You also knew she was fabulously rich. You took her for almost everything before she caught on, and then you passed it off as a horrible miscalculation, knowing she wouldn’t want word of her foolish investment to get out and embarrass her family. Your brother just summoned you back to New York to celebrate the twenty-fifth year of his company and to announce his engagement to none other than Rose den Waldern. You were then approached by Zachary Wellington, the man who had married your sister-in-law, Gayle Hartfort, after she divorced Francis. Turns out Francis just ruined his business, and he was looking for revenge. You suggested destabilizing Francis’s control of Fisk Enterprises, but Zachary seems to have something more personal in mind. You are eager to help him in any way you can.

pages.title: The Murder
pages.HTML:
Francis Fisk is dead! If you and the other guests cannot figure out who the killer is before the power comes back on then you will all be taken in to the police and embroiled in a great scandal. It could ruin your reputation, and you can’t have that.

During Act Two your primary objective is to piece together what happened to Fisk while keeping as many of your own secrets as quiet as you can. You know that you are not the killer, but that doesn’t necessarily mean you have nothing to worry about; if evidence seems to indicate that you committed the crime, the other guests may decide to turn you in to protect themselves! Make certain that you do everything possible to prove your innocence.

pages.title: Special Knowledge and Instructions
pages.HTML:
• Who killed your brother? You know everyone is going to think it was you. You have had enough trouble with the police; you do NOT need to be investigated for murder.

• You have a checkered past that left you with many interesting skills, two of which are safe cracking and cell phone manipulation. If you find either you can access them easily.

• You don’t want any of your sordid past, and present, to come into public light; be sure to protect yourself and gather allies, through whatever means necessary, to protect yourselves.
